intro: Onosma chrysochaeta, commonly known as golden-hair vetch, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they consist of three leaflets, and the flowers are arranged in clusters. Onosma chrysochaeta is often found in open habitats such as coastal areas and dry grasslands.
